description: On March 16, the Edo State Government has called on residents to avoid spreading malicious and unverified information about Covid-19 aimed at causing panic.
Edo State Government has called on residents to avoid spreading malicious and unverified information about Covid-19 aimed at causing panic.
On March 16, the Edo State Government has called on residents to avoid spreading malicious and unverified information about Covid-19 aimed at causing panic.

Nasarawa State,Nigeria, cautioned residents against spreading fake news on coronavirus that could cause panic in the state on March 25 an stated: “The public should rely only on information from government and experts on COVID-19 and not allow themselves to be misled by some unpatriotic elements whose aim is to cause confusion,”.

Osun state, Nigeria, announced April 2 that the governor has signed the Osun Infectious Diseases (Emergency Prevention) Regulations 2020. Under the law transmission or dissemination of false information regarding Covid-19 is an offense and anybody who violates the law will be sentenced to six-month imprisonment or an option of fine upon conviction.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On April 14, Dr Abubakar Ayinla, the Permanent Secretary, state Ministry of Health said that the state government has set up the Risk Communication teams, among others, to manage rumours and fake news circulating as regards COVID-19 in the state.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On April 16, Kogi State Governor, Alhaji Yahaya Bello has denied ever trivialising Covid-19 pandemic as untrue, political and an avenue for corrupt public officials to enrich themselves as claimed in recent social media reports. He is urging the public and good people of Kogi State to disregard the said fake news churned out by agents of mischief whose stock in trade is to mislead the people and cause disaffection in the society.

On May 2, the Edo State governor in Nigeria urged journalists to uphold the ethics of the journalism profession and live up to their responsibilities of providing reliable and credible information to the public amid COVID-19.

The Edo State governor in Nigeria on May 2 "urged journalists to uphold the ethics of the journalism profession and live up to their responsibilities of providing reliable and credible information to the public" amid COVID-19.
Ondo state, Nigeria, on May 8 urges journalists to only publish verified reports.

On May 15, Kwara State Governor, AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq, said the man in a recent video that went viral on social media was not a suspected COVID-19 patient. The governor, who disclosed this during a visit to the state’s isolation centre in Ilorin, however, told journalists that the man was inappropriately evacuated from his home in Ilorin.

On June 2, Edo State Government received Information, Education and Communication (IEC) materials from World Health Organization (WHO) to disseminate of actionable &, credible messages and promote Health & communicate risk, especially during outbreaks such as COVID-19.
target_geog_level: An international organization (e.g. World Health Organization)

description: On June 16th, 2020, Nigeria conducted training of health reporters and journalists on factual reporting on COVID-19 in Kano State. The primary goal was to prevent the spread of fake news surrounding COVID-19 and its status in the country. The non-governmental organization "Breakthrough Action-Nigeria" as well as the Federal Ministry of Health conducted the training in order to help reporters and journalists identify scams, fabricated information, and conspiracy theories, among other issues, before proliferating information and sources.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Nigeria, june 26 - a recent collaboration of the Borno State Government with the World Health Organisation to launch a campaign tagged ‘COVID-19 Heroes Campaign’ launched on May 29 in Borno State.The deputy governor noted that the campaign was aimed at demystifying COVID-19 and putting a stop to the stigmatisation of those affected by the pandemic, adding that sufferers of the disease should be celebrated by all rather than stigmatised.

Osun state, Nigeria, has a one-day training program on Covid-19 reporting for selected radio reporters on July 1. The programme is organized by the Ministry of Information and Civic Orientation in collaboration with the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund(UNICEF).

The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on July 13, 2020 that they were aware of a group of criminals parading in fake Covid-19 Task Force uniforms. These criminals had been arresting people and extorting huge sums of money from them while posturing as working for the government of Anambra State. The government indicated that the only agencies authorized to enforce the Anambra State Covid-19 Law are the members of OCHA Brigade and ATMA. Additionally, the government warned these fake operators that the Anambra State Police Command has been directed to search for, arrest and prosecute anybody masquerading as a Covid-19 Task Force operator.
Nigeria Goverment is aware that Tweets wishing Trump dies of COVID-19 will be removed  from Twittwe
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 18th March Northwest Zone Governors Forum in Nigeria have converged in Kaduna and resolved to close down schools in their states for 30 days. Present at the meeting are the governors of Katsina, Zamfara, Sokoto, Jigawa, Kebbi, Kaduna, and Niger States, while Kano deputy governor Nasiru Gawuna represented governor Umar Ganduje. The closure will take effect from Monday 23rd of March 2020.

Present at the meeting are the governors of Katsina, Zamfara, Sokoto, Jigawa, Kebbi, Kaduna, and Niger States, while Kano deputy governor Nasiru Gawuna represented governor Umar Ganduje. Also among the states to implement the closure is Kwara state, whose governor was absent at the meeting. The closure will take effect from Monday 23rd of March 2020.

description: The Edo State Governor, Godwin Obaseki has launched an online homeschooling platform, EDO-BEST@Home, which enables pupils learn from resources downloaded from an online database while at home. Obaseki said the platform is part of steps taken by the state government to ensure academic engagement by students, who ought to have resumed for a new term on Monday, April 27, but would have to remain at home as a result of the partial lockdown imposed to check the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. The platform supported by State Universal Basic Education Board (SUBEB), MTN Nigeria also benefiting from a strong alliance between the government, the private sector, and the World Bank. The program provides for downloads with zero-data access or through free Short Message Service (SMS). The state is also developing interactive quizzes delivered to parents’ mobile phones. These quizzes are aligned with the state curriculum, and they interrelate with other resources such as digital storybooks and lesson guides delivered to parents. To maximize the interaction between learners and teachers, the government is also working on the deployment of mobile tutors and an online help desk to provide real-time feedback.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

The Edo State Government extended the curfew in the State for another 14 days, starting from May 13. The time for the curfew remained from 8pm to 6am, daily. This was in furtherance of efforts to contain the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the State,” according to the statement.

The Anambra State Government of Nigeria affirmed on May 14, 2020 that it would be strictly enforcing the federal government's curfew, which is in place from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. This curfew was announced by the federal government earlier in May; however, individuals sneaking across the border have forced Anambra to tighten their enforcement measures. The governor of Anambra made clear that from now on there would be no traffic at all into Anambra during these hours, including traffic related to essential goods and services.

COVID-19 has reached state of emergency in Ondo, says Akeredolu, Ondo State Governor Oluwarotimi Akeredolu has expressed worries over the rising spike in COVID-19 cases in the state, with 100 new cases within eight days.  Akeredolu, who noted that as of Monday last week, the state had 74 cases, said that 174 confirmed cases had spread across the three senatorial districts of the state. While addressing journalists during the weekly briefing on the pandemic in Akure, the governor attributed the increase to non-committal attitude of the people to fight it. He said there were 1,052 reported cases, 1,257 samples collected, 71 active cases on admission, 18 deaths while 47 persons had been discharged so far.

On May 16th, 2020, Nigeria commenced Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) training specifically for younger male students, called Almajirai (also commonly spelled Almajiri), in Kano State. This training is for the purpose of reducing the risk of the spread of COVID-19 on the streets of the northern regions of Nigeria, and to move the boys to temporary medical centers before reuniting them with their families.

On June 1, Yahaya Bello, governor of Kogi said that contact tracing should be carried out house to house to identify those who might have made contact with the alleged Kogi COVID-19 index persons. The Kogi State incident management team should continue to thoroughly carry out the contact tracing. The contact tracing shall be fully covered by the mainstream media.

In Nigeria, due to stiff restrictions on international travel, government officials affected by Covid-19 are now receiving medical care in the broken health system they rarely use. The underfunded and under-equipped healthcare system is mostly used by regular Nigerians. Despite huge annual budgets, strike actions by public healthcare workers, and increase emigration of doctors and nurses to other countries worsen the situation.

The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on April 3, 2020 that it has activated COVID-19 isolation and treatment centers. The locations for these centers include NYSC Camp Umuawulu/Mbaukwu, Onitsha General Hospital, and surge centers at Ekwulobia and Umuleri.

Ondo state, Nigeria, announce on April 4 that they will build three additional isolation centers.
Imo State Government in Nigeria "inaugurated six isolation centres" and twenty-eight ambulances on April 5.

In Nigeria on April 7th, the Enugu State Government committed N330,000,000 (Three Hundred and Thirty Three Million Nigerian Naira) to "strengthen the state's coronavirus disease preparedness and response".  This includes "acquisition of PPEs, upgrading isolation centers, operational equipment, medical supply purchases, and other essentials."

On April 10, Kwara State Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq has announced that they refurbished the state’s oxygen plant, over nine years after it last functioned at usable capacity. The revamped facility bolsters Kwara’s capabilities to manage Coronavirus (COVID-19) patients who may require ventilators for a lifeline. The Governor also commended the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) for helping the state to recover looted funds which have become useful in the campaign against COVID-19. AbdulRazaq said the recovered funds strengthened Kwara’s ability to put in place necessary facilities, among other counter-COVID-19 efforts. The Governor said the government has turned around the Sobi Specialist Hospital which is now the COVID-19 response center of the state. He said the administration is now working on having an isolation centre in Offa after which another would be created in General Hospital Kaiama. He also said they had bought five new ambulances (three on the ground and two are on the way). They have 10 ventilators now and they expect to have 30 by the end of the month. They also have a mobile x-ray machine too.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

The Task Force in Gombe, Nigeria has procured over 200 Million Naira worth of medical supplies and consumables including personal protective equipment (PPEs), which have been prepositioned in all health care facilities across the state

The Task Force in Gombe, Nigeria has procured over 200 Million Naira worth of medical supplies and consumables including personal protective equipment (PPEs), which have been prepositioned in all health care facilities across the state

The Covid-19 task center have created three centres for isolating Covid-19 patients as follows: a) A 150-bed capacity hospital at Kwadon which has been fully renovated and furnished for the management of mild-to-moderate cases; b) A 12-bed capacity Intensive Care Unit (ICU) at the State Specialist Hospital, Gombe has been established and is fully equipped for the management of severe cases including mechanical ventilation and other intensive care needs; c) A 50-bed capacity fully equipped facility at Federal Teaching Hospital, Gombe; d) Additional isolation facilities are also being prepared at Funakaye and Kaltungo LGAs in order to ensure effective coverage of the state.
On April 17, the Kogi state government in Nigeria has set up temporary isolation wards at the Confluence Advanced Medical Diagnostic and Imaging Centre (CAMDIC)
Nigeria, April 17 - Abia Commissioner for Health, Dr Joe Osuji, said the state has fully equipped isolation centres.
Nigeria, April 17 - Abia Commissioner for Health, Dr Joe Osuji, said the state has fully equipped isolation centres.
Kebbi has designated an isolation centre at kebbi medical center on april 17, in nigeria.

April 17 - Imo State government said it has equipped six isolation centres at the Okigwe General Hospital, Aboh Mbaise General Hospital, Orlu General Hospital, Federal Medical Centre, Umuguma General Hospital and the Ultra-modern Well-Being Centre.

On April 17, the Ebonyi state government had quipped isolation/treatment centres in Unity Square Abakaliki and another at Ishielu."We have also selected six general hospitals to serve as observation centres, two in each senatorial zone in our response protocol."
Nigeria - Abia Commissioner for Health, Dr Joe Osuji, said the state has fully equipped isolation centres.

The Oyo State Government in Nigeria says it has concluded arrangements for local production of one million face masks for the people of the state. The production is set to start on April 20, and will be done within the week.

Nigeria - ABIA State Governor Dr. Okezie Ikpeazu on Tuesday announced the indefinite closure of the private hospital where the two index cases of the coronavirus in the state were receiving medical attention before their referral to the Federal Medical Centre (FMC) Umuahia.
Ondo State, Nigeria, on April 24 distributed face masks to residents as part of the efforts to contain the spread of the coronavirus in the area.

On April 29, The Edo State Government has received 350,000 facemasks, 10,000 pairs of medical gloves, 18,000 pieces of testing kits, 200 cartons of disinfectant, 40 pieces of decontamination equipment, all valued at over N120 million, from the management of Yongxing Steel Company. The governor expressed appreciation to the Chinese Consulate-General and Yongxing Steel Company for the donation.

description: on the 1st of May, 2020, the Lagos State Governor, Mr. Babajide Sanwo-Olu, commissioned the 118-bed Isolation and Treatment Center set up within the premises of Gbagada General Hospital for management of COVID-19 cases.

On May 1, The Edo State Governor, Godwin Obaseki said that they had continued to provide in-service training, life insurance, and special allowances to all health workers managing the coronavirus pandemic in the state. The Governor also added that the state government has been providing equipment to health workers to facilitate their jobs during this time of Coronavirus.

In Nigeria, the Edo State Governor announced on May 2 that a 40-bed isolation facility being constructed will be ready to "receive confirmed cases of coronavirus" on May 4.
Ondo state, Nigeria, distributes face masks to residents free of charge on May 7.
Ondo state, Nigeria, distributes face masks to residents free of charge on May 7.

On the 7th of May, Kogi State Governor Yahaya Bello has announced full insurance for health workers involved in the fight against coronavirus spread in the state. He said in Lokoja when officials of the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control led by Dr Noah Andrew visited him. The moves were aimed at boosting health workers’ confidence. NCDC delegation that the state Ministry of Health had deployed health workers in the 239 wards making up the state, as well as two officials who would sensitize residents to the dangers of the virus in each of the wards. They have set up three modern isolation/containment centres in the state with 130 bed spaces. Also provided emergency and toll-free numbers for the general public to call in and report suspected cases of Covid-19.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Anambra State Government hosted a distribution of COVID-19 prevention materials for civil servants at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex on May 7, 2020. These materials included hand sanitizers and body temperature thermometers and is aimed to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 as civil servants return to work.

description: Kogi State Governor Yahaya Bello has announced full insurance for health workers involved in the fight against coronavirus spread in the state. The governor made the announcement on the 6th of May, Thursday night in Lokoja when officials of the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control led by Dr Noah Andrew visited him. He said the moves were aimed at boosting the health workers’ confidence. Bello told the NCDC delegation that the state Ministry of Health had deployed health workers in the 239 wards making up the state, as well as two officials who would sensitize residents to the dangers of the virus in each of the wards. He said, “We have set up three modern isolation/containment centres in the state with 130 bed spaces. Also provided emergency and toll-free numbers for the general public to call in and report suspected cases of Covid-19.“
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Osun state, Nigeria, on May 20 commissioned an isolation center with 160 beds in Osogbo as part of efforts to curb the coronavirus pandemic in the state. The government also announced that they had renovated and equipped three other isolation centres which include, 130-bed facility in Ejigbo; 12-bed capacity in Obafemi Awolowo University, Ile-Ife, a 20-bed isolation centre and 8-bed Intensive Care Unit at State Specialist Hospital, Asubiaro, Osogbo, making 342-isolation beds and eight ICU-bed facility in the state.

Lagos state government, through the commissioner of Health, Prof Akin Abayomi, on the 22nd of May, will commence decentralization of isolation of covid-19 patient depending on severity of symptoms. Home-based isolation is set to be introduced and also partnership with private practitioners also.

Lagos state government, through the commissioner of Health, Prof Akin Abayomi, on the 22nd of May, will commence decentralization of isolation of covid-19 patient depending on severity of symptoms. Home-based isolation is set to be introduced and also partnership with private practitioners also.

The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on May 25, 2020 that, effective immediately, all hospitals were expected to create an Isolation Room where any patient whose sample had been taken for COVID-19 testing could be kept while the result of test is awaited. This is intended to reduce the amount of necessary contract-tracing should the person ultimately test positive.
The Sokoto state coronavirus task force distributed facemasks to members of the National Union of Road Transport workers on June 1.

On June 1 in Nasarawa state, First Lady Aisha Buhari renovated and equipped a 15-bed capacity ward and build two sanitary and administrative block in Mararaba Gurku Medical Centre. The 15-bed capacity will be used as isolation center.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on June 2, 2020 that it would be organizing a specialized training on how to manage Covid-19 cases in Anambra State. The state announced it was looking for volunteer doctors, nurses, cleaners and other medical personnel whose services are needed in the management of Covid-19 patients in hospitals.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On June 9, Cross River state government announced the beginning of mass production of PPE, at the state owned garment factory, for trial resumption of public schools. The PPE includes face shields and PPE overalls. They will be distributed to schools free of charge.

On June 9, Cross River state government announced the beginning of mass production of PPE, at the state owned garment factory, for trial resumption of public schools. The PPE includes face shields and PPE overalls. They will be distributed to schools free of charge.

Malam Nasir El-Rufai has formally received the mobile testing vehicle sent by USAID to support the state’s Covid-19 testing efforts. ... The state is seeking to import 40,000 more [GeneXpert machines] to meet its target of 50,000 Covid-19 tests.

description: Nasarawa state, Nigeria, announced on June 18 that they are converting the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) Magaji Dan Yamusa Orientation Camp in Keffi Local Government Area of the state to an isolation centre.

In Nigeria, on June 21, Lagos state government has announced plans to convert their Hajj and pilgrims’ camps to isolation centres to ease the burden on hospital facilities and the limited number of bed spaces.
Starting June 21, the Bauchi state government is converting two schools into isolation centers in order to accommodate more Covid-19 patients.

Kwara state governments have announced plans to convert their Hajj and pilgrims’ camps to isolation centres to ease the burden on hospital facilities and the limited number of bed spaces on June 21 in Nigeria.
On June 21 in Nigeria, the Bauchi State Government has also said it had prepared two schools for conversion into isolation centres.

The Lagos state government on the 26th of June, through the commissioner of Health stated that 7 private laboratories have been approved to carry out covid-19 tests in addition to the 3 public laboratories.
Borno state, Nigeria, inaugurated two health facilities an two ambulances to serve as COVID-19 isolation centres for the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) in the state.

description: The Lagos State Government on 28th June 2020 commissioned a newly-equipped 150-bed isolation centre at the Mainland Infectious Disease Hospital, Yaba, which was donated by the Private Sector Coalition Against COVID19.

On June 30, The Kogi State Government has established a State Reference Molecular laboratory as part of its response to the ravaging corona virus pandemic by the collaboration with the State Commissioner for Health and Secretary, Kogi State Squadron committee on COVID-19 and Centre for Disease Control America. The State Government has also transformed the former FAREC Clinic in Lokoja to Confluence Centre for Infectious Disease (CCID).
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On July 2, Edo State Government says it has increased screening and testing capacity by setting up facilities in churches, mosques and business establishments.

Abia announced the provision of digital thermometers at the state borders to screen interstate travellers are assured by the state as travellers who fail the screening would be turned back or quarantined in the nearest Covid-19 holding area.

On July 4, The Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC) has donated ventilators, X-ray machines, other medical supplies to the Edo State Government to strengthen the state’s response to check the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the state.

description: On July 4, The Kwara State government has announced the receipt of N243m as financial donations from private individuals and corporate bodies between March 27th and July 4th. These expenses covered the purchase of military grade Toyota Land Cruiser Ambulances; automated ventilators and several other Intensive Care Unit (ICU) gadgets/equipment; production of hand sanitizers; and the cost of running the activities of the technical committee and its subcommittees, the statement reads. The expenses also covered the cost of the palliatives that were distributed during the lockdown; renovation of the Sobi Specialist Hospital and the Hajj Camp; mass production of face masks, purchase of surgical masks, digital thermometers, N95 and respirator-sperien 5311 and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Others are; medical supplies and consumables; security expenses; training; allowances for medical personnel and other supportive staff in charge of the pandemic; part-renovation of the Offa General Hospital as an isolation centre; and patients’ management, among others.

The expenses also covered the cost of the palliatives that were distributed during the lockdown; renovation of the Sobi Specialist Hospital and the Hajj Camp; mass production of face masks, purchase of surgical masks, digital thermometers, N95 and respirator-sperien 5311 and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Others are; medical supplies and consumables; security expenses; training; allowances for medical personnel and other supportive staff in charge of the pandemic; part-renovation of the Offa General Hospital as an isolation centre; and patients’ management, among others.

On Friday, July 24th, the Nigerian Government conducted training for 50 TB/HIV/ COVID-19 coordinators on basic Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) practices in Kano State. IPC practices include ensuring early triage, recognition, and source control at the point of entry to a facility, the implementation of hygienic precautions for all patients within facilities, the proper use and disposal of all PPE, and proper social distancing of patients as well as proper ventilation for all facilities housing known COVID-19 patients. Specific precautions vary depending on the type of facility (e.g. patient room, laboratory, waiting/holding room, etc.)

Kwara State Government has announced total lockdown of the state from April 10. The new measure banned all vehicular movement, including private vehicles, all manners of shops and markets. Food sellers and operators of medicine stores are allowed to operate on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays between 10a.m. and 2p.m.

On April 10, Kwara State Government has announced total lockdown of the state. The new measure banned all vehicular movement, including private vehicles, all manners of shops and markets. Food sellers and operators of medicine stores are allowed to operate on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays between 10a.m. and 2p.m. All health workers remain exempted from this lockdown. Kwara Farmers who can identify themselves with any registered farming associations are allowed to go to their farms during the total lockdown the government has declared to prevent the spread of Corona Virus in the state. The Kwara State Technical Committee on COVID-19 also exempted journalists on duty from the lockdown in line with global best practices during such emergencies.  It is also to be noted that previous waivers to manufacturing firms are still valid on the condition that they maintain social distancing and scale down their operations. Petrol stations, banks, and hospitals are also exempted from the lockdown on the condition that all safety protocols are adhered to.

The Katsina State Government brought into force on Saturday April 11, 2020 the "Persons Movement (Restriction) Order 2020." The lockdown order restricts movement of people in the local government areas under lockdown. The local governments under lockdown are those in which cases of Coronavirus (Covid-19) have been recorded.

link: NA ; All movement restrictions in Anambra state have been lifted as of Saturday, April 25, by the governor of the state, Willie Obiano. Reports indicate that all bars, cafes, restaurants, and markets are allowed to open, whilst continuing to observe the state's sanitary guidelines.

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on April 11, 2020 the implementation of a complete lockdown that would last the next two weeks. Only those delivering essential services would be permitted to move around the state and all borders with neighboring states would be closed. Movement within the state was also reopened.

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria announced on May 25, 2020 the creation of community COVID-19 teams for each of the state's wards, following the success of the COVID-19 task force at a state level. These smaller teams would be comprised of the Officer-in-Charge of Primary Healthcare Center, the Community Woman Leader, the Community Youth Leader, the Representative of the Ministry of Health and the Representative of the Civil Society. The teams would be headed by the Councilor of the Ward, but the Local Government Chairman and his Medical Team shall supervise the activities of the entire Team. This new structure is intended to help ramp up testing in local communities.

description: Nigerias Anambra State Government announced on June 2 2020 new protocol for the sampling and reporting of COVID19 cases According to the announcement all members of the Nigerian Medical Association practicing in Anambra State were hereby expected to inform the Ministry of Health once they collect samples of suspected Covid19 patients for testing This is in order to ameliorate a prior issue of members collecting samples and sending them to the testing centers on their own All Covid19 efforts in Anambra State with regards to the collection of samples and the presentation of specimen to NCDC must be centralized going forward

description: On April 28, The Edo State Governor, Godwin Obaseki has launched an online homeschooling platform, EDO-BEST@Home, which enables pupils learn from resources downloaded from an online database while at home. Obaseki said the platform is part of steps taken by the state government to ensure academic engagement by students, who ought to have resumed for a new term on April 27, but would have to remain at home as a result of the partial lockdown imposed to check the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. The platform supported by State Universal Basic Education Board (SUBEB), MTN Nigeria also benefiting from a strong alliance between the government, the private sector, and the World Bank. The state is also developing interactive quizzes delivered to parents’ mobile phones to maximize the interaction between learners and teachers.

description: The Anambra State Government of Nigeria established on May 1, 2020 specific rules for the burial of bodies being brought in from outside Anambra following the lifting of lockdown. The grave must be ready before the corpse arrives at the boundary of Anambra State.

description: on June 27th, 2020, The Rivers State Executive Council has approved Guidelines for Marraiges/Weddings in the state during the period of Covid 19.
type_text: The Rivers State Executive Council has approved Guidelines for Marraiges/Weddings in the state during the period of Covid 19.  Prospective Couples would need to get an approval/ apply to the Governor through the Commisioner for Social Welfare.  All Weddings/Marraiges have an attendance limit of 50 people.  The names, addresses and phone number of all attendees made available with the application (To enable quick contact tracing if the need arises).  Soap and running water has to be kept at the entrance to the venue in not less than three places while all attendees are to wear face masks and maintain social distancing of not less than 2 meters.  Church weddings are to be conducted between 9am and 12noon, while traditional weddings are to be conducted between 4pm and 7pm.  A representative of the Ministry would be present to observe the event.  A fine of N10,000,000 is to be paid by anyone that puts people at risk by breaking this regulation.

description: By July 31st, 2020, the government would commence strict enforcement of the Kwara State Infectious Diseases Regulations 2020. Thenceforth, anyone seen outside without proper use of the face mask will be arrested, prosecuted in a mobile court, and taken to any of our quarantine centres. Their samples will then be taken and they will be held until their status is known. We want to emphasise that shop owners or business managers, drivers of commercial or private vehicles who allow persons without face masks into their shops or vehicles would be arrested alongside offending passengers and be taken to quarantine centres, have their samples taken and be held until their result is out.

Market leaders must ensure that their friends and colleagues as well as customers comply with the standard protocols of COVID-19.

description: On July 24, Kwara State government said that it was setting up a task force to enforce all the new directives, including new guidelines on transport unions and market associations. The Kwara State shopping mall (Shoprite), the Amusement Park, markets, and University of Ilorin Zoological Garden are to close down on Eid Day and the day after Eid, according to the Deputy Governor. It was accepted by cabinet members; police commissioner Kayode Egbetokun; State Commandant of the Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corp Bello Ale; representatives of the Council of Ulamah the Imam Imale of Ilorin Sheikh Abdullah AbdulHameed and Justice Salihu Muhammed; representative of the Christian Association of Nigeria (Kwara) Pastor Moses Popoola; leader of the state transport union AbdulRazaq Ariwoola; representatives of the bankers’ committee led by Victor Inyang; and representatives of the market associations in the state, among others.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

In Nigeria, 90% of port transactions will be done online by March 2021. description: The Katsina State Government of Nigeria announced on March 26th, 2020 that civil servants should observe that day as a work-free day as a measure to prevent the spread of Coronavirus. Osun State reviewed their previous ban on public gatherings of more than 50 persons and changed it to a complete ban, enforcing it on all public gatherings in the state under any banner or organisation from March 21. Osun state announced June 3 that they reopen churches and mosques for two weeks.

Edo State Governor Obaseki had in a gazette signed on May 28 and published on June 5, banned political gatherings that could make direct primary possible in the state stipulating that only indirect primary could be held in the state and in only one location, Benin City.

description: Kwara State Government has said football viewing centres are not allowed to open yet, because such facilities could be a dangerous window for widespread transmission of the Coronavirus among viewers. “The government is aware that the English Premier league commences on June 17. This is to state clearly that viewing centres are not allowed to open under any guise during this pandemic. So, Kwara State Government banned the opening of all football viewing centres across the 16 local government councils in the state.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: For the committee set up by the All Progressives Congress (APC), despite the party’s internal crisis and stiff external opposition, all is set for the primary election in 192 wards of Edo State on June 22. The secretary of the APC primary election Committee, Ajibola Bashiru, said only 18 people would be allowed to gather at the same time during voting to the point of the announcement of result. Also, he said that not more than 18 people including presiding officers and Independent National Electoral Commission observers shall be at ward voting centre at any point in time to carry out their activities without violation of the state’s COVID-19 regulations.

description: On March 23, Governor Yahaya Bello of Kogi State has given directives that tricycle (Keke) operators may carry only one (1) passenger at a time and must provide hand sanitizers for use by their passengers. Also, regular 4-wheeled taxis may carry only three (3) passengers at a time (1 in front and 2 behind) and must provide hand sanitizers for use by their passengers. Furthermore, buses may carry only two (2) passengers per row of seats, subject to a maximum of 10 passengers per trip for any type of bus. Relevant officials are empowered to stop and enforce compliance. Any defaulters will be arrested.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation

On April 2, Edo State Government, as part of a strategy to enforce social distancing in the transportation system, suspended the daily collection of revenues for the month of April. description: On July 31, With the rising number of confirmed cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) in Edo State, the government has urged residents to support efforts to contain the pandemic by observing social distancing and complying with all directives against the spread of the virus, including the compulsory use of facemasks and regular hand washing.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: On July 31, With the rising number of confirmed cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) in Edo State, the government has urged residents to support efforts to contain the pandemic by observing social distancing and complying with all directives against the spread of the virus, including the compulsory use of facemasks and regular hand washing.

By July 31st, 2020, the government would commence strict enforcement of the Kwara State Infectious Diseases Regulations 2020. Thenceforth, anyone seen outside without proper use of the face mask will be arrested, prosecuted in a mobile court, and taken to any of our quarantine centres. Their samples will then be taken and they will be held until their status is known. We want to emphasise that shop owners or business managers, drivers of commercial or private vehicles who allow persons without face masks into their shops or vehicles would be arrested alongside offending passengers and be taken to quarantine centres, have their samples taken and be held until their result is out.
